entry.name: draggable
entry.title: Draggable Widget
entry.desc: Allow elements to be moved using the mouse.

longdesc.p: Make the selected elements draggable by mouse. If you want not just drag, but drag & drop, see the jQuery UI Droppable plugin, which provides a drop target for draggables.

option.name: addClasses
option.desc: If set to false, will prevent the ui-draggable class from being added. This may be desired as a performance optimization when calling .draggable() on hundreds of elements.

option.name: appendTo
option.desc: Which element the draggable helper should be appended to while dragging.

type.name: jQuery
type.desc: A jQuery object containing the element to append the helper to.

type.name: Element
type.desc: The element to append the helper to.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: A selector specifying which element to append the helper to.

type.name: String
type.desc: The string "parent" will cause the helper to be a sibling of the draggable.

option.name: axis
option.desc: Constrains dragging to either the horizontal (x) or vertical (y) axis. Possible values: "x", "y".

option.name: cancel
option.desc: Prevents dragging from starting on specified elements.

option.name: connectToSortable
option.desc: Allows the draggable to be dropped onto the specified sortables. If this option is used, a draggable can be dropped onto a sortable list and then becomes part of it. Note: The helper option must be set to "clone" in order to work flawlessly. Requires the jQuery UI Sortable plugin to be included.

option.name: containment
option.desc: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element or region.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: The draggable element will be contained to the bounding box of the first element found by the selector. If no element is found, no containment will be set.

type.name: Element
type.desc: The draggable element will be contained to the bounding box of this element.

type.name: Array
type.desc: An array defining a bounding box in the form [ x1, y1, x2, y2 ].

option.name: cursor
option.desc: The CSS cursor during the drag operation.

option.name: cursorAt
option.desc: Sets the offset of the dragging helper relative to the mouse cursor. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys: { top, left, right, bottom }.

option.name: delay
option.desc: Time in milliseconds after mousedown until dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

option.name: distance
option.desc: Distance in pixels after mousedown the mouse must move before dragging should start. This option can be used to prevent unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

option.name: grid
option.desc: Snaps the dragging helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. The array must be of the form [ x, y ].

option.name: handle
option.desc: If specified, restricts dragging from starting unless the mousedown occurs on the specified element(s).

option.name: helper
option.desc: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display.

type.name: String
type.desc: If set to "clone", then the element will be cloned and the clone will be dragged.

type.name: Function
type.desc: A function that will return a DOMElement to use while dragging.

option.name: iframeFix
option.desc: Prevent iframes from capturing the mousemove events during a drag. Useful in combination with the cursorAt option, or in any case where the mouse cursor may not be over the helper.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: When set to true, transparent overlays will be placed over all iframes on the page.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: Any iframes matching the selector will be covered by transparent overlays.

option.name: opacity
option.desc: Opacity for the helper while being dragged.

option.name: refreshPositions
option.desc: If set to true, all droppable positions are calculated on every mousemove. Caution: This solves issues on highly dynamic pages, but dramatically decreases performance.

option.name: revert
option.desc: Whether the element should revert to its start position when dragging stops.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: If set to true the element will always revert.

type.name: String
type.desc: If set to "invalid", revert will only occur if the draggable has not been dropped on a droppable. For "valid", it's the other way around.

option.name: revertDuration
option.desc: The duration of the revert animation, in milliseconds. Ignored if the revert option is false.

option.name: scope
option.desc: Used to group sets of draggable and droppable items, in addition to droppable's accept option. A draggable with the same scope value as a droppable will be accepted by the droppable.

option.name: scroll
option.desc: If set to true, container auto-scrolls while dragging.

option.name: scrollSensitivity
option.desc: Distance in pixels from the edge of the viewport after which the viewport should scroll. Distance is relative to pointer, not the draggable. Ignored if the scroll option is false.

option.name: scrollSpeed
option.desc: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance. Ignored if the scroll option is false.

option.name: snap
option.desc: Whether the element should snap to other elements.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: When set to true, the element will snap to all other draggable elements.

type.name: Selector
type.desc: A selector specifying which elements to snap to.

option.name: snapMode
option.desc: Determines which edges of snap elements the draggable will snap to. Ignored if the snap option is false. Possible values: "inner", "outer", "both".

option.name: snapTolerance
option.desc: The distance in pixels from the snap element edges at which snapping should occur. Ignored if the snap option is false.

option.name: stack
option.desc: Controls the z-index of the set of elements that match the selector, always brings the currently dragged item to the front. Very useful in things like window managers.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: Z-index for the helper while being dragged.

property.name: helper
property.desc: The jQuery object representing the helper that's being dragged.

property.name: position
property.desc: Current CSS position of the helper as { top, left } object.

property.name: offset
property.desc: Current offset position of the helper as { top, left } object.
